image.longCaption: Tafadzwa Kamungozi portrait, Chittagong, World T20, March 10, 2014

dismissalText.commentary: Shakib Al Hasan c Panyangara b Kamungozi 101 (99b 10x4 0x6 139m) SR: 102.02

dismissalComment.html: runs down the track and launches a flighted ball straight down long-on's throat! Strikes it at the bottom of the bat so there is no timing on the stroke, even if there had been plenty of intent. Roars of "Shakib, Shakib" follow him all the way through to the dressing room.

dismissalText.commentary: Mushfiqur Rahim c Mire b Panyangara 65 (72b 2x4 2x6 119m) SR: 90.27

dismissalComment.html: fourth chance of the innings and Mushy finally falls! It was the slower ball, which he had looked to launch over long-off. Didn't get enough bat on it because of the length being so full and there being no width to free his arms. Still, he's played a very good hand for his team

chopped on! Tamim decided to cut a ball that barely had width and Zimbabwe benefit from his mistake. It was only mildly short, and he might have pulled some of the pace off it as well. The angled face came down as he hoped to sneak a few runs to third man. Ends up demolishing his stumps

fourth chance of the innings and Mushy finally falls! It was the slower ball, which he had looked to launch over long-off. Didn't get enough bat on it because of the length being so full and there being no width to free his arms. Still, he's played a very good hand for his team
another pin-point yorker, so much that only the off bail leaps off it's perch with the one on leg stump staying put. Mashrafe was trying to squeeze it away through point but was too slow on it

runs at the bowler and has given his wicket away! He was making room for himself and succeeded a little too well. Chatara had pulled his length back as well and the smear over the covers ends up becoming a slice that goes straight up in the air, The Zimbabwe captain comes in from mid-off and takes it quite well because there were a few contenders vying for that catch
gone.! Another false shot has bought his downfall. It was a length ball outside off, Mahmudullah on the front foot tried to clobber it over mid-on but finds Kamungozi

dismissalText.commentary: Tamim Iqbal b Panyangara 5 (15b 1x4 0x6 17m) SR: 33.33

dismissalComment.html: chopped on! Tamim decided to cut a ball that barely had width and Zimbabwe benefit from his mistake. It was only mildly short, and he might have pulled some of the pace off it as well. The angled face came down as he hoped to sneak a few runs to third man. Ends up demolishing his stumps

dismissalText.commentary: Anamul Haque c Chigumbura b Chatara 12 (29b 0x4 1x6 43m) SR: 41.37

dismissalComment.html: runs at the bowler and has given his wicket away! He was making room for himself and succeeded a little too well. Chatara had pulled his length back as well and the smear over the covers ends up becoming a slice that goes straight up in the air, The Zimbabwe captain comes in from mid-off and takes it quite well because there were a few contenders vying for that catch

image.caption: Tafadzwa Kamungozi
image.longCaption: Tafadzwa Kamungozi portrait, Chittagong, World T20, March 10, 2014

dismissalText.commentary: Mahmudullah c Kamungozi b Chatara 1 (9b 0x4 0x6 10m) SR: 11.11

dismissalComment.html: gone.! Another false shot has bought his downfall. It was a length ball outside off, Mahmudullah on the front foot tried to clobber it over mid-on but finds Kamungozi

dismissalText.commentary: Mominul Haque b Nyumbu 31 (46b 2x4 0x6 74m) SR: 67.39

dismissalComment.html: where was the need to play a shot like that? Runs away outside off to try and scoop over fine leg. The length was too full for him to get under, It was too close to off stump and he had left it quite open. Nyumbu says thank you very much and does a little jig

image.caption: Tafadzwa Kamungozi
image.longCaption: Tafadzwa Kamungozi portrait, Chittagong, World T20, March 10, 2014

dismissalText.commentary: Shakib Al Hasan c Panyangara b Kamungozi 101 (99b 10x4 0x6 139m) SR: 102.02

dismissalComment.html: runs down the track and launches a flighted ball straight down long-on's throat! Strikes it at the bottom of the bat so there is no timing on the stroke, even if there had been plenty of intent. Roars of "Shakib, Shakib" follow him all the way through to the dressing room.

dismissalText.commentary: Mushfiqur Rahim c Mire b Panyangara 65 (72b 2x4 2x6 119m) SR: 90.27

dismissalComment.html: fourth chance of the innings and Mushy finally falls! It was the slower ball, which he had looked to launch over long-off. Didn't get enough bat on it because of the length being so full and there being no width to free his arms. Still, he's played a very good hand for his team

dismissalText.commentary: Mashrafe Mortaza b Panyangara 1 (6b 0x4 0x6 8m) SR: 16.66

dismissalComment.html: another pin-point yorker, so much that only the off bail leaps off it's perch with the one on leg stump staying put. Mashrafe was trying to squeeze it away through point but was too slow on it

dismissalText.long: c Mushfiqur Rahim b Mashrafe Mortaza
dismissalText.commentary: Brendan Taylor c Mushfiqur Rahim b Mashrafe Mortaza 54 (72b 4x4 1x6 90m) SR: 75

dismissalComment.html: ooooh, you little beauty! Mushy has pulled off a stunner to get rid of Taylor! This was an offcutter that held in the pitch and leaped up a little more than the batsman expected. He tried to run it down, but gets it a little too fine. Mushfiqur had stepped to his left, then flung himself to his right to grab a ball that had almost gone behind him!

dismissalText.commentary: Hamilton Masakadza lbw b Mahmudullah 42 (48b 7x4 0x6 69m) SR: 87.5

dismissalComment.html: that's the big one! The bowling change has worked as Hami M is declared leg before! Mahmudullah moved around the wicket, pitched on middle and gets the ball to turn enough to hit him in front of middle. That's plumb!

there it is! You cannot keep him out of the game as he dupes Raza in the flight and gets him out stumped! The batsman had wandered forward but Shakib had pulled his length back, and gave it a little extra rip to beat the prodding bat and topple an important wicket

good length ball on middle, Sibanda has trusted a sweep but has top-edged it into the hands of short fine leg! There was no conviction behind the stroke, he simply wanted to get off strike and had chosen the wrong ball to hit across the line. Two wickets in the over then for Shakib

that's three for Shakib as he breaks through Mire's defences. Not that he offered much with a slog sweep across the line of an arm ball. Too full for that shot, not enough room either and Zimbabwe are heading towards a tame end as Chittagong rejoices

taken at slip, which means he is the 12th player in history to hit a ton and claim four or more wickets in the same ODI. It was full and pushed through on off stump, the drive he was hoping to entice came through and there was just enough turn for outside edge, which was safely snapped up

another Zimbabwe batsman perishes to the sweep. It seems to be a go to shot, but they are not picking the balls. It was quick, flat and full. Didn't allow him to time for the stroke and he has to walk back
one ball after Shakib's spell is done, Sunny cleans up Chatara to record Bangladesh's first win of 2014. It was a skidder, pitching on a good length and ripping through his defences.

dismissalText.long: st Mushfiqur Rahim b Shakib Al Hasan
dismissalText.commentary: Sikandar Raza st Mushfiqur Rahim b Shakib Al Hasan 15 (22b 1x4 0x6 33m) SR: 68.18

dismissalComment.html: there it is! You cannot keep him out of the game as he dupes Raza in the flight and gets him out stumped! The batsman had wandered forward but Shakib had pulled his length back, and gave it a little extra rip to beat the prodding bat and topple an important wicket

dismissalText.long: c Rubel Hossain b Shakib Al Hasan
dismissalText.commentary: Vusi Sibanda c Rubel Hossain b Shakib Al Hasan 0 (2b 0x4 0x6 1m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: good length ball on middle, Sibanda has trusted a sweep but has top-edged it into the hands of short fine leg! There was no conviction behind the stroke, he simply wanted to get off strike and had chosen the wrong ball to hit across the line. Two wickets in the over then for Shakib

dismissalText.commentary: Hamilton Masakadza lbw b Mahmudullah 42 (48b 7x4 0x6 69m) SR: 87.5

dismissalComment.html: that's the big one! The bowling change has worked as Hami M is declared leg before! Mahmudullah moved around the wicket, pitched on middle and gets the ball to turn enough to hit him in front of middle. That's plumb!

image.longCaption: Regis Chakabva portrait, World Cup 2011, February 11, 2011

image.caption: Regis Chakabva
image.longCaption: Regis Chakabva portrait, World Cup 2011, February 11, 2011

dismissalText.commentary: Regis Chakabva b Mahmudullah 9 (17b 0x4 0x6 33m) SR: 52.94

dismissalComment.html: not this time! He's made Chakabva play all around a tossed up delivery. He was lunging forward and turned a relatively harmless delivery into a yorker and then played across the line to have his stumps rearranged

dismissalText.long: c Mushfiqur Rahim b Mashrafe Mortaza
dismissalText.commentary: Brendan Taylor c Mushfiqur Rahim b Mashrafe Mortaza 54 (72b 4x4 1x6 90m) SR: 75

dismissalComment.html: ooooh, you little beauty! Mushy has pulled off a stunner to get rid of Taylor! This was an offcutter that held in the pitch and leaped up a little more than the batsman expected. He tried to run it down, but gets it a little too fine. Mushfiqur had stepped to his left, then flung himself to his right to grab a ball that had almost gone behind him!

dismissalText.long: c Sabbir Rahman b Mashrafe Mortaza
dismissalText.commentary: Elton Chigumbura c Sabbir Rahman b Mashrafe Mortaza 15 (28b 0x4 0x6 37m) SR: 53.57

dismissalComment.html: hit straight to short cover and captain gets captain! It was a slower ball again, this one full enough to invite the drive and Chiggy doesn't keep it down. Zimbabwe are sinking, and Bangladesh are well on their way to their first win in 2014. Good time for drinks, no?

dismissalText.commentary: Solomon Mire b Shakib Al Hasan 11 (18b 0x4 1x6 29m) SR: 61.11

dismissalComment.html: that's three for Shakib as he breaks through Mire's defences. Not that he offered much with a slog sweep across the line of an arm ball. Too full for that shot, not enough room either and Zimbabwe are heading towards a tame end as Chittagong rejoices

dismissalText.commentary: Tinashe Panyangara b Arafat Sunny 7 (9b 1x4 0x6 20m) SR: 77.77

dismissalComment.html: another Zimbabwe batsman perishes to the sweep. It seems to be a go to shot, but they are not picking the balls. It was quick, flat and full. Didn't allow him to time for the stroke and he has to walk back

dismissalText.long: c Mahmudullah b Shakib Al Hasan
dismissalText.commentary: John Nyumbu c Mahmudullah b Shakib Al Hasan 4 (9b 0x4 0x6 18m) SR: 44.44

dismissalComment.html: taken at slip, which means he is the 12th player in history to hit a ton and claim four or more wickets in the same ODI. It was full and pushed through on off stump, the drive he was hoping to entice came through and there was just enough turn for outside edge, which was safely snapped up

dismissalText.commentary: Tendai Chatara b Arafat Sunny 10 (20b 1x4 0x6 24m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: one ball after Shakib's spell is done, Sunny cleans up Chatara to record Bangladesh's first win of 2014. It was a skidder, pitching on a good length and ripping through his defences.

dismissalText.commentary: Tendai Chatara b Arafat Sunny 10 (20b 1x4 0x6 24m) SR: 50

commentTextItems.html: one ball after Shakib's spell is done, Sunny cleans up Chatara to record Bangladesh's first win of 2014. It was a skidder, pitching on a good length and ripping through his defences.

commentPostTextItems.html: The next ODI here on Sunday will start at 12.30 pm and not 1.30 pm like today to try and ward off any chances of dew playing to much of a part in the game. That's all we have for you today though. So join us then. Thank you for your comments and your company

Shakib Al Hasan is the Man of the Match "Me and Mushy had a very good partnership. I dont know what I have changed in bowling. Have been bowling a lot and I love to contribute but when it is my day I have to make sure it belongs to me. It was a brilliant performance, but still there are areas where we need to improve and hope we do well in the next four games. It's a relief [winning the first ODI in 2014]"
"More important matches are coming and we are focussed on that," says Mashrafe Mortaza.

"I thought the start we had was excellent but when Shakib and Musfiqur came in, they played really well. Our fielding was off as well, we didn't take our chances. One guy was scoring a hundred, another was hitting a fifty for them and that's where we need to improve. Some of the balls were spinning, but it was a good decision to bowl and it was a chaseable score but we kept losing wickets," says Elton Chigumbura, "Obviously, we have four more games and we need to bounce back, especially the next one"

"The boys are really hungry. Credit goes to Shakib. I took my time and Shakib was going from ball one so that helped me. We knew if we got to 250, it was par and our bowlers bowled really well as well. One of us had to have stayed till the end and that was why we have won. We want to win the next match as well, all of us are focussed on that," says Mushfiqur Rahim

8.55 pm Zimbabwe barely posed a fight, an affliction that has been with them all tour. It was a trial by spin again and there wasn't much improvement to be found. But it has been Shakib's day again. He slammed a century that helped restore a top-order wobble and then help them race away to better-than-par total. He came back with the ball and took four wickets to put himself down as the 12th player, and the first Bangladeshi to hit a century and take four or more wickets in the same match

commentTextItems.html: a hat-trick of fours for Kamungozi! This was fuller and outside off, he goes down on one knee and nails a square drive to the point boundary. So no five-for for Shakib, still a ton and four wickets is better than most

image.caption: Tafadzwa Kamungozi
image.longCaption: Tafadzwa Kamungozi portrait, Chittagong, World T20, March 10, 2014

commentTextItems.html: this is short and Kamungozi rocks back and cuts through the covers
mid-off was not deep enough to pose a threat to this. Ran back as much as he could and he dived too, but Kamungozi's trek down the track gives him four runs
oh dear, that was close! It was slower through the air and the batsman had lunged forward to block. It takes the outside edge and squirts away past silly point
this is short and he backs away to cut to short cover

commentPreTextItems.html: Here's Shakib again... with five around the bat

commentTextItems.html: flighted on middle, kept out
goes back to chop a flatter delivery on off stump to third man for a couple

image.caption: Tafadzwa Kamungozi
image.longCaption: Tafadzwa Kamungozi portrait, Chittagong, World T20, March 10, 2014

commentTextItems.html: tossed up on off stump, nudged to mid-off
defends a flighted delivery outside off
keeps out a fuller ball on middle and leg
tossed up on middle and Chatara is forward to block
good length ball on off stump, Chatara blocks off the back foot
good length ball on off stump, defended

image.caption: Tafadzwa Kamungozi
image.longCaption: Tafadzwa Kamungozi portrait, Chittagong, World T20, March 10, 2014

commentPreTextItems.html: Slip, gully, leg gully, silly point, short leg in place

commentTextItems.html: pushed through full on off stump, drilled into the covers

dismissalText.long: c Mahmudullah b Shakib Al Hasan
dismissalText.commentary: John Nyumbu c Mahmudullah b Shakib Al Hasan 4 (9b 0x4 0x6 18m) SR: 44.44

commentTextItems.html: taken at slip, which means he is the 12th player in history to hit a ton and claim four or more wickets in the same ODI. It was full and pushed through on off stump, the drive he was hoping to entice came through and there was just enough turn for outside edge, which was safely snapped up
looped up on off stump and it was slow enough to tempt Nyumbu into a slog. beaten
short and outside off, chopped away into the point region. Shakib isn't too pleased with the single
flighted on middle and leg, defended
tossed up on off stump, Nyumbu was looking to drive through long-off but gets an inside edge

dismissalText.commentary: Solomon Mire b Shakib Al Hasan 11 (18b 0x4 1x6 29m) SR: 61.11

dismissalComment.html: that's three for Shakib as he breaks through Mire's defences. Not that he offered much with a slog sweep across the line of an arm ball. Too full for that shot, not enough room either and Zimbabwe are heading towards a tame end as Chittagong rejoices

dismissalText.commentary: Tinashe Panyangara b Arafat Sunny 7 (9b 1x4 0x6 20m) SR: 77.77

dismissalComment.html: another Zimbabwe batsman perishes to the sweep. It seems to be a go to shot, but they are not picking the balls. It was quick, flat and full. Didn't allow him to time for the stroke and he has to walk back

dismissalText.long: c Mahmudullah b Shakib Al Hasan
dismissalText.commentary: John Nyumbu c Mahmudullah b Shakib Al Hasan 4 (9b 0x4 0x6 18m) SR: 44.44

dismissalComment.html: taken at slip, which means he is the 12th player in history to hit a ton and claim four or more wickets in the same ODI. It was full and pushed through on off stump, the drive he was hoping to entice came through and there was just enough turn for outside edge, which was safely snapped up

dismissalText.commentary: Tendai Chatara b Arafat Sunny 10 (20b 1x4 0x6 24m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: one ball after Shakib's spell is done, Sunny cleans up Chatara to record Bangladesh's first win of 2014. It was a skidder, pitching on a good length and ripping through his defences.

image.caption: Tafadzwa Kamungozi
image.longCaption: Tafadzwa Kamungozi portrait, Chittagong, World T20, March 10, 2014

dismissalText.commentary: Tafadzwa Kamungozi not out 12 (8b 3x4 0x6 11m) SR: 150

dismissalComment.html: ooooh, you little beauty! Mushy has pulled off a stunner to get rid of Taylor! This was an offcutter that held in the pitch and leaped up a little more than the batsman expected. He tried to run it down, but gets it a little too fine. Mushfiqur had stepped to his left, then flung himself to his right to grab a ball that had almost gone behind him!

hit straight to short cover and captain gets captain! It was a slower ball again, this one full enough to invite the drive and Chiggy doesn't keep it down. Zimbabwe are sinking, and Bangladesh are well on their way to their first win in 2014. Good time for drinks, no?

another Zimbabwe batsman perishes to the sweep. It seems to be a go to shot, but they are not picking the balls. It was quick, flat and full. Didn't allow him to time for the stroke and he has to walk back
one ball after Shakib's spell is done, Sunny cleans up Chatara to record Bangladesh's first win of 2014. It was a skidder, pitching on a good length and ripping through his defences.

there it is! You cannot keep him out of the game as he dupes Raza in the flight and gets him out stumped! The batsman had wandered forward but Shakib had pulled his length back, and gave it a little extra rip to beat the prodding bat and topple an important wicket

good length ball on middle, Sibanda has trusted a sweep but has top-edged it into the hands of short fine leg! There was no conviction behind the stroke, he simply wanted to get off strike and had chosen the wrong ball to hit across the line. Two wickets in the over then for Shakib

that's three for Shakib as he breaks through Mire's defences. Not that he offered much with a slog sweep across the line of an arm ball. Too full for that shot, not enough room either and Zimbabwe are heading towards a tame end as Chittagong rejoices

taken at slip, which means he is the 12th player in history to hit a ton and claim four or more wickets in the same ODI. It was full and pushed through on off stump, the drive he was hoping to entice came through and there was just enough turn for outside edge, which was safely snapped up

that's the big one! The bowling change has worked as Hami M is declared leg before! Mahmudullah moved around the wicket, pitched on middle and gets the ball to turn enough to hit him in front of middle. That's plumb!

image.caption: Regis Chakabva
image.longCaption: Regis Chakabva portrait, World Cup 2011, February 11, 2011

dismissalComment.html: not this time! He's made Chakabva play all around a tossed up delivery. He was lunging forward and turned a relatively harmless delivery into a yorker and then played across the line to have his stumps rearranged

image.caption: Regis Chakabva
image.longCaption: Regis Chakabva portrait, World Cup 2011, February 11, 2011

image.caption: Tafadzwa Kamungozi
image.longCaption: Tafadzwa Kamungozi portrait, Chittagong, World T20, March 10, 2014

dismissalComment.html: there it is! You cannot keep him out of the game as he dupes Raza in the flight and gets him out stumped! The batsman had wandered forward but Shakib had pulled his length back, and gave it a little extra rip to beat the prodding bat and topple an important wicket

dismissalComment.html: good length ball on middle, Sibanda has trusted a sweep but has top-edged it into the hands of short fine leg! There was no conviction behind the stroke, he simply wanted to get off strike and had chosen the wrong ball to hit across the line. Two wickets in the over then for Shakib

notes: Bangladesh innings
Powerplay 1: Overs 0.1 - 10.0 (Mandatory - 27 runs, 2 wickets)

Bangladesh: 100 runs in 25.2 overs (152 balls), Extras 8
5th Wicket: 50 runs in 60 balls (Shakib Al Hasan 27, Mushfiqur Rahim 18, Ex 5)
Shakib Al Hasan: 50 off 57 balls (4 x 4)
Drinks: Bangladesh - 135/4 in 32.0 overs (Shakib Al Hasan 57, Mushfiqur Rahim 20)
Bangladesh: 150 runs in 33.6 overs (204 balls), Extras 9
Powerplay 2: Overs 35.1 - 40.0 (Batting side - 48 runs, 0 wicket)
5th Wicket: 100 runs in 103 balls (Shakib Al Hasan 59, Mushfiqur Rahim 40, Ex 6)
Bangladesh: 200 runs in 39.4 overs (239 balls), Extras 12
Mushfiqur Rahim: 50 off 59 balls (1 x 4, 2 x 6)
Shakib Al Hasan: 100 off 95 balls (10 x 4)
Bangladesh: 250 runs in 47.3 overs (287 balls), Extras 16
Innings Break: Bangladesh - 281/7 in 50.0 overs (Sabbir Rahman 44, Arafat Sunny 1)
Zimbabwe innings
Powerplay 1: Overs 0.1 - 10.0 (Mandatory - 59 runs, 2 wickets)
Zimbabwe: 50 runs in 8.2 overs (50 balls), Extras 11

Zimbabwe: 100 runs in 18.3 overs (111 balls), Extras 12
BRM Taylor: 50 off 66 balls (4 x 4, 1 x 6)
Zimbabwe: 150 runs in 31.4 overs (190 balls), Extras 15

Powerplay 2: Overs 35.1 - 40.0 (Batting side - 12 runs, 3 wickets)

milestones.description: Mushfiqur and Shakib's 148-run partnership is BAN's highest for the 5th wicket in ODIs, breaking the record of 119 between Shakib and Raqibul Hasan
Shakib has scored 32 fifty-plus scores in ODIs, the most for BAN breaking Tamim Iqbal's record

stories.title: Zimbabwe v Bangladesh, 2014-15
stories.subTitle: 1st ODI, Chittagong
stories.seoTitle: Wisden Almanack review: Zimbabwe v Bangladesh, 2014-15
stories.summary: Wisden's review of the first ODI, Zimbabwe v Bangladesh, 2014-15

stories.title: After false start, Sabbir sparks to life
stories.subTitle: Zimbabwe in Bangladesh 2014-15
stories.seoTitle: After false start, Sabbir sparks to life
stories.summary: Touted as the explosive finisher Bangladesh have always lacked, Sabbir Rahman struggled during the World T20, but has repaid the selectors' faith in him with a sparkling cameo on his ODI debut against Zimbabwe

image.caption: Sabbir Rahman flicks one away
image.longCaption: Sabbir Rahman flicks one away, Bangladesh v Sri Lanka, 2nd T20I, Chittagong, February 14, 2014

stories.title: 'I feel I am calmer now' - Shakib
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 1st ODI, Chittagong
stories.seoTitle: 'I feel I am calmer now' - Shakib
stories.summary: After marking his ODI comeback to the Bangladesh team with a hundred and a four-for, Shakib Al Hasan admitted that he was feeling "relaxed and calm", a new side to him which he felt was bringing rich dividends

image.caption: Shakib Al Hasan attacks during his 101
image.longCaption: Shakib Al Hasan attacks during his 101, Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 1st ODI, Chittagong, November 21, 2014

stories.title: Chigumbura rues dropped catches
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 1st ODI, Chittagong
stories.summary: Zimbabwe captain Elton Chigumbura felt that it was dropped catches and early wickets that cost his side the first ODI against Bangladesh

image.longCaption: Mushfiqur Rahim drives through the covers, Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 1st ODI, Chittagong, November 21, 2014

stories.title: All-round Shakib breaks 13-match winless streak
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 1st ODI, Chittagong
stories.summary: Bangladesh won an ODI after 383 days and broke their 13-game hoodoo, cleverly defending 281 on a blanket of dew and causing Zimbabwe to fall 87 short
stories.byline: The Report by Mohammad Isam in Chittagong

image.caption: Mushfiqur Rahim and Shakib Al Hasan added 148 for the fifth wicket
image.longCaption: Mushfiqur Rahim and Shakib Al Hasan added 148 for the fifth wicket, Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 1st ODI, Chittagong, November 21, 2014

stories.title: Fresh squad gives Chigumbura hope
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 1st ODI, Chittagong
stories.seoTitle: Fresh squad gives Elton Chigumbura hope
stories.summary: Elton Chigumbura, the Zimbabwe captain, insisted that his team is in good spirits despite the 3-0 loss in the Tests to Bangladesh and a defeat in the practice match ahead of the five-ODI series

image.caption: Elton Chigumbura pulls during his 45 off 28 balls
image.longCaption: Elton Chigumbura pulls during his 45 off 28 balls, Hong Kong v Zimbabwe, World T20 warm-up, Chittagong, March 12, 2014

stories.title: Mashrafe wants to break ODI losing streak
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 1st ODI, Chittagong
stories.seoTitle: Mashrafe Mortaza wants to break ODI losing streak
stories.summary: Bangladesh are famished for ODI success in 2014 and the new captain Mashrafe Mortaza hopes to use the momentum from the Test series to turn things around

image.caption: Mashrafe Mortaza has a chat with Shakib Al Hasan
image.longCaption: Mashrafe Mortaza has a chat with Shakib Al Hasan, Dhaka, September 25, 2014

stories.title: Teams seek ODI lift in dark 2014
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 1st ODI, Chittagong
stories.seoTitle: Teams seek ODI lift in dark 2014
stories.summary: The upcoming series will offer the two bottom-placed ODI teams a chance to improve their record in a format that has yielded mostly poor results in 2014
